intro: Boscia prunoides, commonly known as the yellow boschia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Boscia prunoides is also valued for its ornamental qualities and traditional uses in local communities.
